global.textOriginal:
I bought the Gym Monster two months ago and have been actively using it almost every day since then. I am very satisfied with the device because it allows even complete beginners to learn and progress quickly and effectively. My two sons are also enthusiastic about the device.
However, I have had problems with the Bluetooth ring and handles disconnecting from the very beginning, so I contacted technical support. Their response was very quick and they soon offered me a solution to replace these accessories. Now I am waiting for the replacement accessories to arrive to test them.
Currently, I use the device without the help of Bluetooth devices and turn on the weight manually (on the screen), which is also an option, but it is less convenient than using wireless accessories.
I bought the Gym Monster device along with all the accessories and the rowing machine and I must say that everything is made of extremely high quality. I also like that the device and accessories do not take up much space and are therefore suitable for smaller spaces.
Overall, I am very satisfied with the device itself, as well as the communication and accessibility of technical support, and I can recommend this device to anyone who wants to exercise and tone their body, but doesn't have much time for fitness. You won't regret it.

global.textOriginal: Weâ€™ve had the Speediance Gym Monster for several months now, and itâ€™s been a game changer for our whole family. My teenage boys use it to build strength and improve their performance for soccer, and I love that I can create safe, controlled routines for them without worrying about heavy free weights. The system tracks their progress automatically, which keeps them motivated and competitive with each other.As a busy professional, the Gym Monster has been just as valuable for me. I can fit in a full, high-quality workout anytime â€” early morning, late at night, or between meetings â€” without leaving home. The resistance feels incredibly smooth, the setup is compact, and the software keeps improving with new workouts and smart features.Itâ€™s rare to find something that works so well for both adults and teens, but this machine does it all. Itâ€™s solid, versatile, and honestly feels like having a personal trainer and full gym right in the house.If I had one wish, it would be for a slightly wider, sturdier platform â€” especially for users who have the space. That small upgrade would make an already excellent system even better.Highly recommend it for families or anyone who wants the flexibility to train effectively at home.

tr.headline: Great machine from a long time gym member!
tr.textOriginal: I purchased the Gym Monster (GM 1) almost 6 months ago and I have been incredibly pleased with the product and its versatility.  As a long time gym goer, I am impressed with the machine's ability to adapt to all workouts, with significant weight capacity, up to 220 lbs.  (And in fact if feels heavier than lifting regular weights due to the electronic pulley resistance / technology.) The machine is easy to set up - it basically works straight out of the box, and it's pretty intuitive with the various workouts and movements.  There are a ton of workouts and programs available from beginner level to more advanced types of movements and courses.  What's even more exciting is the community around the machine where some users can upload their custom workouts for all members to use.  So you will find hundreds of movements and workouts available for the various muscle groups. And even better is the community on Facebook where a lot of users can help with technical troubleshooting and/or offer advice for weightlifting as necessary.  (Reddit as well, but Facebook has more audience in my opinion.) The AI aspect (software) is pretty powerful and automatically adjusts the weight for my intensity, and in a recent software update, it offers programs and workouts to fit my specific goals. It will also adapt to my daily/weekly workout routine and suggest different workouts and programs based on my muscle fatigue.  I think it's pretty cool! Overall it's a great, smart, at-home gym that rivals a real gym workout experience, and in my opinion, better than a lot of other competing products in the market.

tr.headline: Great product, great company.
tr.textOriginal: I have had my Gym Monster nearly a year and I love it. I love how compact, easy to use and versatile it is. This is the only piece of equipment you need. But beyond that the company is amazing. Every time I've reached out with questions or suggestions they have been incredibly receptive. Sincerely thanking me for taking the time to message them and they have even implemented suggestions I made promptly. They really do listen and care. And in the time I've had the machine, it has had so many significant updates to the software that I almost feel guilty that I'm getting them for free. Most recently they added heart rate monitor connectivity that works beautifully. There is still a little room for improvement regarding the AI usage and predictive fatigue... but at the rate they constantly improving I have no doubt they'll get to it. And I love that they do not require a monthly subscription and still provide such high quality programming making it much easier to justify the upfront cost.

tr.headline: Life-changing product
tr.textOriginal: Speediance might have not invented the smart home gym, but they made it available to the masses. I am the type of guy who has paid for a gym membership for the past 4 years and have been a total of about 10 times in that time. With 2 kids, a full time job and the challenges of daily life, I never had time to go to the gym. And the odd time I went, I was intimidated by the people waiting for machines. Who wants to chest press 75lbs while the guy before was using 200lbs? That's not to mention if another guy stands next to me waiting for me to be done. Then, I really felt the pressure to either finish quickly or leave. That's not to mention sitting on equipment used by someone else and not wiped clean. Well, the Speediance Gym Monster fixed all that. Now, I have my own machine that does everything I need in terms of strength training. I waited 2 months before posting a review, and here's my assessment so far : 1) The convenience of being able to work out for 15 or 20 mins whenever you have free time is amazing. It let's me squeeze in a few movements here and there that I would've never been able to do in a gym because of lack of time. 2) The resistance is accurate in term of weight, but if "feels" even heavier than static weights because it's actually pulling against you. 3) I have managed to visibly build muscle in 2 months while only working out 3 times a week for about 30-40 minutes. 4) There's pre-made workouts for beginners like me. It starts you off with some targeted stretches to reduce the risk of injury while working out. It also gives you breaks between movements and finishes your workout with more stretches. 5) The developpers actually update the software to make it better. You're not buying a machine that will be stuck in 2025 for 6 years. 6) The machine will start you off with small weights and calculate how easy you're doing the reps. It will gradually increase the weight until it senses you're actually struggling. It will store all that info for the next time you work that specific muscle group. Considering I used to go to the gym once every 3 months, I used to have to write down how much I can handle of every machine. No more of that nonsense. 7) I have increased the weights I can lift by about 40% in 2 months. I was stagnant for 3 years because I wasn't regular enough. Now, there's no excuse not to work out for 15-20 mins before a shower a few times a week. 8) The machine lets you create different profiles for different users. My wife has her weight data and presets, I have mine. Overall, it's a beautiful product that has changed how I see strength training and that will certainly have a deep impact on my health on the long run.

us.headline: Great compact weight machine for at home!
us.textOriginal: I really like this device.  It is effective but yet nice and compact. I have been utilizing the machine for about 5 months now, at least 20x per month.  There is a large variety exercise plans that they come out with on a regular basis. They will have a monthly challenge that will encourage you to do about 15 workouts in a 20 day span. There is also an AI driven workout program but I havenâ€™t tried it yet.  You can also make custom workouts and workout with a partner. The weight feels really smooth 98% of the time.  If it feels off, itâ€™s often just a quick fix by slowly extending the cable then allowing it to retract slowly.  The weight can go up to 110lbs per cable or 220 total.  As long as you are not trying to go very heavy with benching, deadlifts, or whatnot it will be a pretty solid option at home. One small annoyance that I do find is that the bench included wobbles a little.  Other minor software bugs have been getting fixed on a regular basis and the UI keeps improving.  The Facebook user group is very active and they will often respond to questions or comments on there. When you are looking at ordering this, I would strongly encourage you to think about how you expect to get the device in place.  Itâ€™s really heavy and going down/up stairs is very much a two person job and not for lightweights.  If you think it might be too heavy for you it probably is and you might want to get an upgraded delivery.

With ongoing updates and attention to detail, this has the potential to be the best all-in-one smart gym on the market. Highly recommend it overall.

us.headline: A Game-Changer for Safe, Efficient Home Workouts
us.textOriginal: After injuring my shoulder with traditional dumbbells over a year ago, I was hesitant about getting back into strength training. The Speediance Gym Monster 2 has completely transformed my approach to working out and helped me return to regular exercise with confidence. The machine's safety features stand out as its greatest strength. The assist modes and automated weight adjustments have allowed me to rebuild my strength gradually without fear of reinjury. Unlike my previous setup with just dumbbells and a bench, the Speediance provides controlled, smooth movements that feel secure and stable throughout each exercise. The build quality is exceptional - this is a serious piece of equipment. It arrived quickly via Amazon Prime shipping, though I'd strongly advise having help for the delivery and setup (I actually ended up helping our delivery team carry it in!). Despite its substantial weight, which speaks to its quality construction, setup was straightforward once it was in place. What truly sets this machine apart is how it streamlines the workout experience. The on-screen guidance eliminates the guesswork from my sessions, while automatic rest time and weight tracking keep me focused on the exercises rather than managing details. I'm completing workouts more efficiently than ever before, and the variety of exercise options keeps things interesting and engaging. The interface is intuitive and well-designed, making it easy to follow along with preset workouts or create custom routines. The team behind Speediance appears committed to continuous improvement, regularly updating features and responding to user feedback. One of my favorite things -- no subscription fee. I didn't want to deal with the other companies who are charging so much for equipment and then throw a $40-$60 fee on top of it every month. The biggest transformation has been in my attitude toward working out. What started as a cautious return to exercise has become something I genuinely look forward to. The combination of guided workouts, progress tracking, and the sheer convenience of having a comprehensive gym in my home has made fitness feel more accessible and enjoyable than it was with my previous basic setup. For anyone recovering from an injury or looking to upgrade their home gym with a safer, more sophisticated solution, the Speediance Gym Monster 2 is worth serious consideration. It's not just a piece of exercise equipment - it's a complete fitness system that makes consistent, safe training accessible at home.

us.headline: Great machine, especially for beginners!
us.textOriginal: I used to not work out at all but I wanted to start getting in shape. I had been looking at different options and the only options I could really come down to were the Tonal and the Speediance. Tonal was quickly out of the question due to being semi-permanently fastened to the wall, and the monthly membership fees. I became set on the speediance due to it being more compact, maneuverable and cheaper. Don't get me wrong, these things are still super expensive but in my eyes totally worth it for helping get into shape. We got the GM2 Works Plus on sale because of the few extra accessories like the adjustable bench. I've only been using this for a couple weeks, the first week was rough on my body, but now I notice I'm wanting to work out more because of how I'm feeling week 2. My body just feels a little bit better, I can only imagine what it will feel like after using this thing continually. I don't like going to the gym and I'm not a big fan of physical weights. I like that the speediance offers video to show you how to do each workout and the form. The accessory variety in a small form factor is really nice. I was expecting the electromagnetic pulley system to be more clunky but it really isn't. The only time I have issues, and maybe it's me, is when doing leg workouts and pulling to either side of the machine. The rope kind of rubs the wrong way on the plastic housing just outside the pulley, which I can see causing the rope to fray over time. Workout programs offered are pretty easy to setup. Overall, great machine if you're one who doesn't like to go to the gym or don't have a lot of time to workout, this makes it a lot easier to hop into a workout for 15m or an hour+.

us.headline: Internal storage issue / PSA: needs 5Ghz WiFi!!
us.textOriginal: Update 5/30/25 - back to 5 Stars. Speediance shipped a new monitor, which was super easy to install with just 3 screws in the back. No everything is back to normal operation and no issues/error so far. Have been using the new monitor for about two weeks. This was originally 5 stars. I'm currently down-grading this because of a technical issue relating to the internal storage (see pics). It tells you that the internal storage is full (which seems crazy in 2025 and I have only around 12 exercises book-marked). Then when you click clear files, it tells you they're gone, but they are not really gone and you can't get back to the main screen from the storage screen. You have to turn the machine off and on again. Soon after the same issue pops up with the same files. I wonder if there's a way to increase the internal storage via the usb port in the back? Also please NOTE: do NOT put this machine on 2.4Ghz wifi, it NEEDS 5Ghz. Otherwise, the load times are crazy slow (a complaint I've read in other comments/reviews). Putting it on 5Ghz wifi makes it super fast. Necessary fixes in my opinion: 1) Turn off music by default and include Spotify and other services (or at least make it an option to turn it off by default) 2) Increase internal storage space or make it possible to expand 3) Fix grammatical/syntactic/lexical errors in the frontend software (not highest priority obviously) Overall, this thing is great, especially since you don't need a subscription, which is what I wanted to avoid at all cost. It feels like a full home gym and is built solidly.

de.headline: 5 yÄ±ldÄ±z Ã¼zerinden 5,0 Great Experience So Far â€” Despite All My Initial Concerns
de.textOriginal: Before making a big purchase like this, I tend to do quite deep research to find out all the possible issues and what can go wrong with the device so I can be prepared. After spending a week on YouTube videos, Reddit, and Facebook communities, I gathered the most common issues people had: updates causing freezes, device breakdowns, Bluetooth ring connection issues, premature cable fraying/snapping, and attachment ball breakage. Seeing that most YouTube reviews were from people who received the device for free didnâ€™t help my concerns and made me even more skeptical about the product. To make my decision, I went to Ulm to have a demo and try out the device. The demo was great and the machine worked perfectly. Despite my concerns, I decided to give it a try and ordered through Amazon. So far, I have only had a great experience and havenâ€™t encountered any of the issues mentioned above. Packaging I received one big box, so I assumed either the bench or the row attachment was missing â€” but as a very nice surprise, everything was included in that one large box. Quality Both my friend and I were very positively surprised by the quality of the packaging, the main unit, and also the bench and row attachments (I was expecting lower-quality accessories). Both the bench and the row are sturdy and quite heavy. Everything was well packaged and clearly labeled, and it was super easy and quick to set everything up. All the screws and holes aligned perfectly. Functionality & Performance When I turned on the device, it forced me to do an update, and I was afraid of the infamous â€˜screen freezeâ€™ issue. Since it was mandatory, I had no choice â€” but there were zero issues. The device functions very well. I havenâ€™t encountered any bugs or problems. The cables move smoothly and silently, and the fans are also very quiet. Iâ€™ve also never had a disconnection issue with the Bluetooth ring (maybe theyâ€™ve fixed it). I donâ€™t know if it helped, but I turned the two Bluetooth antennas on the back of the screen outward to improve reception. Something I didnâ€™t think about when buying this was how great it is for rehab and physiotherapy. I have issues with my hip (tight hip flexors) and my back. There are rehab movements in the app that you can use to create your own program, and they are very effective. Considering how hard it can be to get physio appointments and stay consistent with therapy, this feature is gold for your health. Durability As Iâ€™ve had the device for less than a week, I cannot comment much on long-term durability. This is the only part I am still a bit concerned about, since Iâ€™ve seen that some people had premature cable snaps or attachment ball breakage. I believe Speediance changed the cable material between models, and these new cables might have some issues, as most premature failures seem to happen with the GM2. Verdict So far, I am in love with the device and very satisfied with the purchase! Being able to do a complete workout at home, as well as stretches, quick sessions before work or bed, and even physio exercises, is incredibly nice. I hope the device proves durable, and that in case of any issues, Speedianceâ€™s after-sales service is as good as the pre-sales. I will update this review in the upcoming months based on my experience.

de.headline: Great compact weight machine for at home!
de.textOriginal: I really like this device.  It is effective but yet nice and compact. I have been utilizing the machine for about 5 months now, at least 20x per month.  There is a large variety exercise plans that they come out with on a regular basis. They will have a monthly challenge that will encourage you to do about 15 workouts in a 20 day span. There is also an AI driven workout program but I havenâ€™t tried it yet.  You can also make custom workouts and workout with a partner. The weight feels really smooth 98% of the time.  If it feels off, itâ€™s often just a quick fix by slowly extending the cable then allowing it to retract slowly.  The weight can go up to 110lbs per cable or 220 total.  As long as you are not trying to go very heavy with benching, deadlifts, or whatnot it will be a pretty solid option at home. One small annoyance that I do find is that the bench included wobbles a little.  Other minor software bugs have been getting fixed on a regular basis and the UI keeps improving.  The Facebook user group is very active and they will often respond to questions or comments on there. When you are looking at ordering this, I would strongly encourage you to think about how you expect to get the device in place.  Itâ€™s really heavy and going down/up stairs is very much a two person job and not for lightweights.  If you think it might be too heavy for you it probably is and you might want to get an upgraded delivery.

de.headline: Impressive Smart Gym With Room for Small Improvements
de.textOriginal: Iâ€™ve been using the Speediance Gym Monster 2 since the start of the year, and itâ€™s been a great experience overall. Itâ€™s incredible how much this smart gym can do with just cables and digital resistance in such a compact design. I did notice some minor fraying on my right cable after consistent use, but Speedianceâ€™s support team was responsive and replaced my cables while sending me angle adapters free of charge. From what Iâ€™ve seen in the community, I may have gotten luckyâ€”others have mentioned that the adapters are sold separately for around $70â€“$80, which feels a bit steep since they help prevent a design issue that can lead to cable wear. That said, I really appreciate how Speediance continues to improve the product and listens to user feedback. With ongoing updates and attention to detail, this has the potential to be the best all-in-one smart gym on the market. Highly recommend it overall.

de.headline: Truly a game changer
de.textOriginal: Truly a game changer.  The super small footprint means I can actually use it in my studio apartment, unlike most other universal gyms or a squat rack.  It's incredibly quiet, so I don't have to worry about annoying the people living on the floor below me. It also has smooth, consistent resistance up to 220lbs, which is more than enough for me.  And mostly importantly, unlike its competitors (e.g. Tonal, Vitruvian, etc), you don't have to pay a monthly fee to access all the important features!!! I have had a few minor issues already, like one cable fraying after doing hip thrusts, but Speediance customer support has been absolutely incredible and they sent me a replacement cable for free (their new upgraded cable made of fray resistant material) immediately after I contacted them about it.  And they also just released an adapter that solves the fraying problem when using the weight belt with the lower platform attachment slots too, so the company is adapting to issues remarkably quickly.  All of which has given me enough confidence to give them a 5 star review here. p.s. Just make sure to join their official facebook group if you get one, since it's a great resource and their reps on it are super super helpful as well.

de.headline: A Game-Changer for Safe, Efficient Home Workouts
de.textOriginal: After injuring my shoulder with traditional dumbbells over a year ago, I was hesitant about getting back into strength training. The Speediance Gym Monster 2 has completely transformed my approach to working out and helped me return to regular exercise with confidence. The machine's safety features stand out as its greatest strength. The assist modes and automated weight adjustments have allowed me to rebuild my strength gradually without fear of reinjury. Unlike my previous setup with just dumbbells and a bench, the Speediance provides controlled, smooth movements that feel secure and stable throughout each exercise. The build quality is exceptional - this is a serious piece of equipment. It arrived quickly via Amazon Prime shipping, though I'd strongly advise having help for the delivery and setup (I actually ended up helping our delivery team carry it in!). Despite its substantial weight, which speaks to its quality construction, setup was straightforward once it was in place. What truly sets this machine apart is how it streamlines the workout experience. The on-screen guidance eliminates the guesswork from my sessions, while automatic rest time and weight tracking keep me focused on the exercises rather than managing details. I'm completing workouts more efficiently than ever before, and the variety of exercise options keeps things interesting and engaging. The interface is intuitive and well-designed, making it easy to follow along with preset workouts or create custom routines. The team behind Speediance appears committed to continuous improvement, regularly updating features and responding to user feedback. One of my favorite things -- no subscription fee. I didn't want to deal with the other companies who are charging so much for equipment and then throw a $40-$60 fee on top of it every month. The biggest transformation has been in my attitude toward working out. What started as a cautious return to exercise has become something I genuinely look forward to. The combination of guided workouts, progress tracking, and the sheer convenience of having a comprehensive gym in my home has made fitness feel more accessible and enjoyable than it was with my previous basic setup. For anyone recovering from an injury or looking to upgrade their home gym with a safer, more sophisticated solution, the Speediance Gym Monster 2 is worth serious consideration. It's not just a piece of exercise equipment - it's a complete fitness system that makes consistent, safe training accessible at home.
